pros: Amazing coworkers. RNs and Techs for the most part are professional and have good attitudes.
cons: Paper charts used for orders mixed with EMR. 6:1 ratio on the floor for nurses. Nurses Floating to higher acuity floors without proper training. Anytime they can cut back on staffing they will. Charge nurses almost always have a full assignment.

pros: Loved the nursing and MD staff.
cons: upper management is money hungry and leaves staff no out to dry. They do not look out for the nurses with experience

review_title: Mediocre at best, Bad at worst

pros:
There were no pro's to working at Crestwood Medical Center in Huntsville, AL and their corporate affiliate is just as bad.
I was forced to give this facility one star in order to complete my review.
cons: It's infested with corruption and illegalities. They've been turned into 'governing bodies' multiple times and lied their way out of it. They've been sued by former employees in the past and are currently in an active lawsuit from a former employee now.

pros: Good hours. If you plan on being bullied and belittled- stay for more than 10 years and you can sleep at work and get paid. And go to your car for 2 hour lunches and management turns a blind eye.
cons: Horrible Management unless your buddy buddy. Managers bully and belittle employees. Low pay. Health insurance is expensive (and this is a hospital!!). Makes all employees “essential” in bad weather and covid. Employees that have been there forever- do very little and get by without doing their job. Dirty work environment. Poor equipment to do your job (outdated phones and computers always going down). No paid holidays- comes out of PTO. No bonuses.

pros: Employees are friendly. And convenient to my place.
cons: Low salary and high health insurance.

pros: Great coworkers on the unit.

pros: Start pay is decent. In the beginning the atmosphere was professional and comfortable. Benefits are great.
cons: Turn over is high so the ones left to do the work are often overworked and under appreciated. Not enough priority to hire Phlebotomist.

review_title: Hospital is like a big family.
pros: Small 150-bed hospital. It's like a family where everyone knows one another. Great House Supervisor that cares about nurses and helps out.
cons: Higher up admin people doesn't care about people working on the floor. All they care about are the HCAPS. No help and no consideration from them when census is full and unit is short staffed.

job_title: Human Resources Manager in Huntsville, AL
pros: Positive attitudes, employees really care about what they do and the patients.  Employees treat each other with mutual respect.
cons: Too much email communication, most likely due to the fact that everyone is so busy, they don't feel they have the time to spare to make a call and risk not reaching the party to whom they wish to communicate.

pros: Equal opportunity employer, great salary with benefits, wonderful staff to work with.
cons: Poor staffing (inability to staff enough RN's), no transport for patients postoperative surgery.

review_title: Since becoming a CHS facility, benefits, compensation, and management quality has plummeted.
pros: Probably the better of the two hospitals in the area.  Most of the employees are great to work with, but that probably won't last long.
cons: CHS is a "for profit" organization.  The focus has shifted from quality patient care to make as much money as we can.

pros: Some benefits.  Some decent surgeons.
cons: CNAs and Nurses are Overworked, very long hours, charting & documentation time-consuming, understaffed, unrealistic pace of new admits and discharges without adequate staff to complete tasks, poor communication amongst all staff.
